question: Can I afford a home loan of $300,000 with my current savings and income?
true_answer: Yes, based on your savings and income, you can afford a home loan of $300,000 with a 5% down payment and a DTI ratio of 33%.

steps.content: Can I afford a home loan of $300,000 with my current savings and income?
Plan: 1) Get details on savings and income. 2) Use home_loan_agent for affordability criteria. 3) Calculate DTI and savings for down payment. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Please provide your current savings and monthly income.
I have $30,000 in savings and a monthly income of $6,000.
Retrieving knowledge on home affordability criteria.
Standard criteria involve a DTI below 43% and a minimum down payment of 5%.
Calculating DTI and examining savings for down payment.
DTI calculated as 33%. Savings sufficient for a 5% down payment ($15,000).
What interest rate should I expect?
Current average interest rate is around 3.5% for a 30-year fixed mortgage.
Review complete. All calculations and data are correct.
Yes, based on your savings and income, you can afford a home loan of $300,000 with a 5% down payment and a DTI ratio of 33%. Expect an interest rate around 3.5%.
